hopobject.name: pico
hopobject.http_browser: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9.0.5) Gecko/2008120122 Firefox/3.0.5
hopobject.body:
Pico Projector Development Kit

Congratulations on your new DLP Pico Projector. This is where you can find some demos to try it out with your BeagleBoard.

Initializing and SD card

With a Linux host

If you already have a Linux host, great. That means you are likely already familiar with most of the things required to make the most of your Pico Projector and BeagleBoard setup. You'll need to now acquire a 1GB or greater SD card and an adapter that works with your Linux host to configure Linux on your BeagleBoard.

  1. Download pico_sd_fat.tar.bz2.
  2. Download pico_sd_ext3.tar.bz2.
  • How to install Linux
    • The instructions will be high-level and point to the OMAP Developer's Series YouTube videos
  • How to program the demo image onto an SD card
    • This image will be created with a script something like mksdimg.sh and can be written to a 512MB SD card using dd
